title: Fix Create Employee form submission and employee list display

requirements.text: Fix the Create Employee form submission in EmployeesPage.tsx so that when the user fills in employee details and submits, the data is actually sent to and persisted in the Motoko backend canister.

quotes: i have entered employee data but it was not executed

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking the Create Employee button opens the employee creation form
Filling in the form fields and submitting calls the backend createEmployee (or equivalent) mutation
No errors occur during submission and data is persisted to the canister
The form closes after successful submission

requirements.text: Ensure the employee creation form in EmployeeForm.tsx includes the following fields: Name, Job Title, Department, Email, and Salary. These fields must be validated before submission.

quotes: new employee data appear in the list

acceptanceCriteria: Form includes input fields for Name, Job Title, Department, Email, and Salary
All fields are validated (non-empty, email format for Email, numeric for Salary) before submission

requirements.text: Update the Motoko backend to accept and store all required employee fields: name, job title, department, email, and salary. Ensure the getEmployees query returns all stored employees with these fields.

quotes: new employee data appear in the list

acceptanceCriteria: The Employee type in main.mo includes fields for name, jobTitle, department, email, and salary
A createEmployee function accepts these fields and persists the employee
A getEmployees function returns the full list of all stored employees

requirements.text: After a successful employee creation, the employees list/table in EmployeesPage.tsx must immediately refresh and display the newly created employee without requiring a page reload.

quotes: new employee data appear in the list

acceptanceCriteria: The employee list/table updates immediately after a successful form submission
The newly created employee is visible in the table with all filled-in fields
React Query cache is invalidated on successful mutation to trigger a re-fetch

requirements.text: Display a confirmation toast or success message to the user after a new employee is successfully created.
acceptanceCriteria: A success notification (toast or inline message) appears after successful employee creation
The message confirms the employee was created successfully
The notification disappears automatically after a few seconds

constraints: Do not change existing authentication or access control logic
Do not modify files in frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or frontend/src/components/ui
Keep all Motoko logic in backend/main.mo single actor
nonGoals: Adding new HR dashboard features beyond employee creation and listing
Changing the visual theme or overall layout of the HR dashboard
Implementing employee editing or deletion in this request
Adding profile photo upload or document attachments
